parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From ana and choreo; to retire.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A little girl, a young girl; a girl, maiden. Neuter of a presumed derivative of kore; a girl.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To sleep, be sleeping. From kata and heudo; to lie down to rest, i.e. to fall asleep.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To laugh at, ridicule. To laugh down, i.e. Deride.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
